one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. From the past week's study, what made the most significant impact to you in the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 1 Kings 7:1-51.
Solomon constructed his palace and commissioned the temple furnishings.

questions.questionText: 3. Why does Scripture mention the time Solomon spent building the temple and the palace at this point? What are some possible lessons?
4. How was Huram described? How does this affect your thinking about different ways to serve God?
5. What was the purpose of the temple vessels and furnishings in Solomon's day? To whom did they point? (Use 2 Chronicles 4; Hebrews 9:1-23; Revelation 21:22-22:5 or any other reference.)

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 1 Kings 8:1-11.
The priests brought the ark of the covenant to the Most Holy Place.

questions.questionText: 6. What did the ark of the covenant signify? What is meaningful to you about the ark's transport and placement? (Use Exodus 25:22; 1 Samuel 4:21-22; 6:1-21 or any other reference.)
7. How does God dwell among people today? How can you be sure God dwells in you? (Use John 10:29; 2 Corinthians 6:16 or any other reference.)

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 1 Kings 8:11-21.
The dark cloud filled God's temple.

questions.questionText: 8. Who and what did the dark cloud that filled the temple represent? (See Exodus 24:15-18; 33:7-11.)
9. Where and how is the Lord's glory seen since the days of Jesus Christ? (See Psalm 19; Acts 2; 2 Corinthians 3:17-18 or any other reference.)
10. What opportunities is God giving you to reflect His character?
11. Solomon celebrated and told others of God's faithfulness to keep His promises. How will you do the same thing?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 1 Kings 8:22-66.
Solomon prayed and dedicated the temple.

questions.questionText: 12. What did Solomon's prayer reveal about his understanding of and belief about God?
13. What did Solomon's prayer reveal about his understanding of and belief about the nation of Israel, and all mankind?
14. How might Solomon's prayer affect the way you pray? What will you put into practice?
15. What did you learn about God? What did you learn about yourself?
